title: Adversarial Deep Learning-Based Autonomous Driving Radar Target Detection Security Project

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Project-based learning focused on radar signal processing and deep learning model implementation in digital environments.

learning_goals: Learners can construct an FMCW radar signal processing pipeline and explain the range-Doppler (RD) map generation process.
Learners can implement a multi-level deep learning network (DAALnet/TDDLnet) for adversarial attack detection.
Learners can achieve over 90% accuracy in target distance/velocity prediction under attack scenarios by applying PSO optimization techniques.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
